Tags: inference-rule inclusion class python collection

InferenceRuleInclusionCollection (python class)ÔÉÅ

class punctilious.InferenceRuleInclusionCollection(t)ÔÉÅ

This python class models the collection of inference-rules included in a theory-elaboration-sequence.

In complement, it conveniently exposes as python properties a catalog of natively supported inference-rules that are automatically included in the theory-elaboration-sequence when they are accessed for the first time.

property absorb: AbsorptionInclusionÔÉÅ

The well-known absorption inference-rule: (P ‚üπ Q) ‚ä¢ (P ‚üπ (P ‚àß Q)).

Unabridged property: u.i.absorption

If the well-known inference-rule does not exist in the universe-of-discourse, the inference-rule is automatically declared.

property absorption: AbsorptionInclusionÔÉÅ

The well-known absorption inference-rule: (P ‚üπ Q) ‚ä¢ (P ‚üπ (P ‚àß Q)).

Abridged property: u.i.absorb

If the well-known inference-rule does not exist in the universe-of-discourse, the inference-rule is automatically declared.

property axiom_interpretation: AxiomInterpretationInclusionÔÉÅ

The axiom_interpretation inference-rule: ùíú ‚ä¢ P.

If the well-known inference-rule does not exist in the universe-of-discourse, the inference-rule is automatically declared.

WarningÔÉÅ

Axiom-interpretation is especially dangerous because, contrary to most inference-rules, it allows the introduction of arbitrary truthes in the theory. For this reason, one must be very attentive when applying this inference-rule to assure the resulting formula-statement complies / interprets properly its related contentual-axiom.

WarningÔÉÅ

For this reason, one must be very attentive when applying this inference-rule to assure the resulting formula-statement complies / interprets properly its related contentual-definition.

property modus_ponens: ModusPonensInclusionÔÉÅ

The well-known modus-ponens inference-rule: (P ‚üπ Q), P ‚ä¢ Q.

Abridged property: u.i.mp

The implication (P ‚üπ Q) may contain free-variables. If such is the case, the resulting Q‚Äô is computed by extracting variable-values from P‚Äô and applying variable-substitution.

If the well-known inference-rule does not exist in the universe-of-discourse, the inference-rule is automatically declared.
